text: Full Gear (2021) was a professional wrestling pay-per-view show made by All Elite Wrestling (AEW). It took place on November 13, 2021 at the Target Center in Minneapolis, Minnesota. It was the third Full Gear event held by AEW. The main event saw "Hangman" Adam Page defeat Kenny Omega to win the AEW World Championship. Page performed two Buckshot Lariats on Omega before pinning him for the victory. He then celebrated with members of The Dark Order. During the show, Jay Lethal made his AEW debut. Cody Rhodes also made his last AEW PPV appearance before leaving the company three months afterwards. ==Matches== No. Results Stipulations Times 1 Hikaru Shida and Thunder Rosa defeated Jamie Hayter and Nyla Rose (with Vickie Guerrero) Tag team match 12:32 2 MJF defeated Darby Allin Singles match 22:01 3 Lucha Brothers (Penta El Zero Miedo and Rey Fénix) (c) (with Alex Abrahantes) defeated FTR (Dax Harwood and Cash Wheeler) (with Tully Blanchard) Tag team match for the AEW World Tag Team Championship 18:36 4 Bryan Danielson defeated Miro by technical submission Finals of the AEW World Championship Eliminator Tournament 20:00 5 Christian Cage and Jurassic Express (Jungle Boy and Luchasaurus) defeated The Superkliq (Adam Cole and The Young Bucks (Matt and Nick Jackson)) (with Brandon Cutler and Michael Nakazawa) Falls Count Anywhere match 22:20 6 Cody Rhodes and Pac (with Arn Anderson) defeated Malakai Black and Andrade El Idolo (with José the Assistant) Tag team match 16:51 7 Dr. Britt Baker, D.M.D. (c) (with Rebel and Jamie Hayter) defeated Tay Conti Singles match for the AEW Women's World Championship 15:24 8 CM Punk defeated Eddie Kingston Singles match 11:08 9 The Inner Circle (Chris Jericho, Jake Hager, Sammy Guevara, Santana and Ortiz) defeated Men of the Year (Ethan Page and Scorpio Sky) and American Top Team (Junior dos Santos, Andrei Arlovski, and Dan Lambert) Minneapolis Street Fight 19:36 10 "Hangman" Adam Page defeated Kenny Omega (c) (with Don Callis) Singles match for the AEW World Championship 25:30 ==References== Category:2021 in American sports Category:2020s in Minnesota Category:AEW Full Gear Category:Sports in Minneapolis
title: Full Gear (2021)
